qas.question: How many execution methods are currently used in the United States?
What was the most common historical method of execution in the United States?
In what state did the last burning at the stake take place in the US?
Who was the last person hanged in chains in the Untied States?
When was execution by beheading ended in Utah?
How many execution methods are currently outlawed in the United States?
What was the least common historical method of execution in the United States?
In what state did the first burning at the stake take place in the US?
Who was the first person hanged in chains in the Untied States?
When was execution by beheading started in Utah?

context: Various methods have been used in the history of the American colonies and the United States but only <a0_0><b5_0>five<b5_0/><a0_0/> methods are currently used. Historically, burning, crushing, breaking on wheel, and bludgeoning were used for a small number of executions, while <a1_0><b6_0>hanging<b6_0/><a1_0/> was the most common method. The last person burned at the stake was a black slave in <a2_0><b7_0>South Carolina<b7_0/><a2_0/> in August 1825. The last person to be hanged in chains was a murderer named <a3_0><b8_0>John Marshall<b8_0/><a3_0/> in West Virginia on April 4, 1913. Although beheading was a legal method in Utah from 1851 to <a4_0><b9_0>1888<b9_0/><a4_0/>, it was never used.
